Activity: Arrive at work, settle in, grab a coffee, and check personal emails and news websites.
Log in to the EHR system and review any urgent notifications or messages related to medical records access or system updates.
Begin abstracting data from the 2023-2024 influenza season records. Start with electronic records, prioritizing those with complete vaccination and diagnosis data.
Focus on the first batch of 25 records. Methodically extract patient demographics, vaccination dates, influenza diagnosis codes (ICD-10), antiviral medication usage, and relevant lab results.
Take a short break to stretch and clear my head. Maybe browse some photography blogs.
Lunch Break: Head to the cafeteria for lunch.
Continue data abstraction, focusing on the next batch of 25 electronic records. Pay close attention to any inconsistencies or missing information.
Encountered an issue with accessing specific lab results within the EHR. Compose an email to @helpdesk-1 describing the problem and requesting assistance with access permissions.
Continue data abstraction while waiting for help desk's reply. Focus on information already readily available like demographics and vaccination dates.
Review the 50 records abstracted today to ensure data accuracy and completeness. Make necessary corrections.
Document the number of records completed and any challenges encountered in the daily log. Prepare for tomorrow's work.
Wrap up for the day and head home.
